page.title: 01BISHOPS WOOD
page.content: Bishops Wood is a small rural village on the Staffordshire-Shropshire border. Most of the houses are modern,detached residences, with some semi-detached and a few of the original cottages. The nearest large town is Telford, which is eleven miles away. There are few purpose-built facilities in the village. It has a church, one pub and one Post Office incorporated in the Farm Shop. Villages provide a lot of home-made entertainment. There is an entertainments committee which organises dances, quizzes and so on. From a sample survey we discovered that over three-quarters of the population travel over 10 miles to work. We would say that it is a commuter village.
